75$Condition: Other$8/4/2009 8:14:21 AM$Reviewer: EngrDan, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$My treatment started for migraines. A 250 mg of depakote twice a day and 25 mg of pamelor once a day. This cleared up most of my migraines and the ones I did get were weak in comparison. My life was much better. When I changed neurologist I had to do a stress test for the heart because the two meds together caused heart flutters. So I was taken off the pamelor then all H… broke loose. I became depressed and developed IBS and my migraines came more often and more painful. I was in a downward spiral for two years. My life is getting back to normal but I am not happy about post pamelor conditions.  I now take prozac which helped ease up the post symptoms.

column3: home physical therapy
column4: ice
column5: stretching

column1: I advise to titrate up really slowly

column4: local pharmacist says Neurontin mostly just makes you sleepy and someday I may have no choice) Right now
column5: this is helping some
column6: not interfering with my life and I can still titrate up to 50mg a day if needed.

column1: Good luck to all of us nerve pain sufferers-many of us look & try to act quite normal
column2: but spend a lot of time in misery."

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Pamelor is for me although I was gaining weight

column1: I sometimes have drowsiness when awaking in the morning on occasions. Sometimes I go through weak periods where sitting becomes a necessity
